content: click to settings>general and untick the setting to use the new experimental setup feature and try the setup again
creator: davidsk

content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content:
Hai seguito questa guida? https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/thunderbird-gmail

Sul dominio personalizzato hai abilitato l'accesso da client?

content: Check Shark settings, not Thunderbird settings. VPNs are notorious for interrupting flow of email.
creator: davidsk

content:
Hi Dave.

Dave said
I have installed a Surfshark VPN and I now cannot send emails. I've changed the port, location and protocol but it still does not work. Any other suggestions please

I have never had such a problem with Mullvad VPN or Proton VPN. You may want to try them.
creator: mozilla98

content: Thunderbird is just an agent, sending syntactically-correct email into the internet. It cannot know that the address does not exist.

content:
Hi.

Have you verified the settings with your e-mail service provider?

This process does not create a username and password. You must have them for an account that you established with your e-mail service provider. Do you have them?
creator: mozilla98

content: Sorry, that's how IMAP works. Are you sure the new email address can't be set for POP? Anyway, with IMAP, I suggest you each set up filters to COPY desired messages to a separate folder. You would each have to folders other than the inbox, HIS and HERS. The filter could COPY those that are typically to you ( such as those from your personal or business contacts) her filter could the same. Then, browse through other mail in the inbox and copy those to the HIS folder. You would each be able to 'see' the others folder, but you're in a trusting relationship so that wouldn't be an issue. A BENEFIT of an IMAP account is that you could then read messages on your phone.
creator: davidsk

content: TIP: Gmail does allow POP. There is a setting in the online account to allow POP.
